question: Which among the following is NOT correctly matched?
explanation:
• Open Sky Policy refers to a policy of liberalisation and ease of access and rule of use of National Airports for the Foreign Airlines.
  • Operation Leech was a tri-services (Army, Navy and Air Force) operation by Indian Armed Forces on 11 February 1998. The operation was against Burmese rebels who involved into gun-running from Andaman’s Landfall Island. Six rebels were killed and 73 rebels were arrested in the operation.
  • The London Declaration was a declaration issued by the 1949 Commonwealth Prime Ministers' Conference on the issue of India's continued membership of the Commonwealth of Nations after its transition to a republican constitution.
